Home → Events and activities

Events and activities

Easter holiday events

Performances and screenings, storytimes and craft activities, Easter egg hunts and more for children.

See what's on during the Easter holidays →

Regular children's activities

Songs, stories & crafts, Minecraft, reading & writing groups for toddlers, pre–school & primary age.

Regular older people's activities

Coffee groups, history, arts & crafts for older people and their carers.

Special events

A list of upcoming special events for all ages.

Free beginner computer courses

Free courses for complete computer and internet beginners.

Presents screenings

Presents, top quality screenings of theatre, ballet and exhibitions across our libraries.

Reading groups

Join a library group and find out about setting up your own.

Ceremonies in the Northgate Room

Ipswich County Library’s Northgate Room is licensed to hold weddings, civil ceremonies and other celebrations.

Suffolk Writes

Suffolk Writes is a project giving you the opportunity to make your written work available for Suffolk Libraries customers to borrow.

Skulduggery in Stowmarket, 26 - 29 April 2019

Suffolk's newest crime writers' festival returns for a second year. Guests include Stella Duffy, Sophie Hannah and Nicci French.

Slaughter in Southwold, 15 - 16 June 2019

The annual seaside crime writers' festival is back. Meet Val McDermid, Mick Herron, Elly Griffiths, Martin Edwards and more, and solve a murder mystery written by Ann Cleeves.
